title: Redesign the Textual config wizard into a guided, editable setup flow so an operator can complete standard adapter configuration without leaving the TUI.

five_acts.act_1_context: The existing config surface was flat and mostly read-only, forcing operators to leave the TUI for common setup work and reducing onboarding clarity.
five_acts.act_2_build: Implemented a structured Textual config experience with adapter status projections, inline env editing through shared config handlers, guided progression, and notifications summary rendering.
five_acts.act_3_conflict: Round-one review identified behavioral defects in env write replacement and guided-step completion logic, plus a redundant guided auto-advance call.
five_acts.act_4_resolution: The fix round shipped targeted patches with regression tests, then a second review verified all Important findings were resolved and approved delivery.
five_acts.act_5_outcome: Operators can now complete adapter configuration inside the TUI with keyboard-first guided flow, immediate persistence and validation feedback, and no placeholder notifications surface.
